thread.title: Wetherpoon boss ridiculed for fashion faux pas on Good Morning Britain

author: Max Channon
title: Wetherpoon boss ridiculed for fashion faux pas on Good Morning Britain
text:
Wetherpoon boss ridiculed for fashion faux pas on Good Morning Britain What was he thinking? Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
The boss of pub giant Wetherspoon has had his dress- ense ridiculed, after making a fashion faux pas on national TV.
Tim Martin, who lives in Devon, joined Susanna Reid and Ben Shephard on ITV's Good Morning Britain, where he is a regular guest, to discuss his opinions on Brexit and other political matters.
The outspoken businessman wore his usual polo shirt ensemble, but this time he paired the navy blue top with a cerulean blue jumper draped over his shoulders.
The striking combination stood out to many Good Morning Britain viewers, reports The Liverpool Echo.
Twitter user @WillAddedDigits said: "There's a bloke on #GMB with a cardigan draped over his shoulders. I instantly take his opinion over all others."
Luke Jackson said: "If anyone was to have a sweater draped over the shoulders on live TV, it would be Tim Martin."
And @pinknouveau said: "Tim Martin looks so chill. He’s going down the spa after his interview with GMB...
A number of users even called him a 'legend'.
Tim was on the show to discuss how currency market volatility is hurting sales and profits.
Asked what his final piece of advice to Theresa May would be, Tim said: "Theresa, cut those tariffs, forget Chequers, don't pay £39billion, regain control of fishing and we will all be really happy."
He didn't, however, offer her any fashion tips. Want more news?
